name: Devstack User Onboarding.txt - 1. Onboarding Script
description: This section explains the process of running an onboarding script that enables access to a Kubernetes cluster and configures the necessary tools for running a development stack (devstack). The script sets up the local environment by configuring the kubectl command-line tool and installing required tools. It also provides instructions for validating the successful setup by running kubectl commands.
use_cases: Enabling access to a Kubernetes cluster for developers
Configuring local development environment for working with devstack
Installing necessary tools for running devstack
Validating successful setup and access to the cluster

name: Devstack User Onboarding.txt - 2. (Optional) Manual Steps for Getting Access - MacOS
description: This section provides instructions for manually configuring access to the Devstack cluster on macOS, in case the automated onboarding script fails or if access is needed for other operating systems like Windows or Linux. It covers steps like getting cluster access through a Spinnaker pipeline, configuring the local Kubernetes config file, setting up authentication using Azure OIDC, adding the Devserve cluster, and installing required tools like Helmfile for managing Kubernetes manifests and Devspace for enabling file sync.
use_cases: Manually onboarding to the Devstack cluster on macOS
Onboarding to the Devstack cluster on Windows or Linux
capabilities: Getting cluster access via Spinnaker pipeline
Adding Devserve cluster to local config
Installing Helmfile for managing Kubernetes manifests
Installing Devspace for enabling file sync
